definition: to open a business/to open a practice/open (for business)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: In the same year, the territory's first public indoor garden show in the opening scissors Lane.

sentences.english: Today, a grand opening ceremony is held in Nantong Zhanyang Fiber Co.
sentences.chinese: 今天，南通展陽纖維有限公司隆重舉行開業典禮。

sentences.english: Disaster situation, the sea shortly world Street bars unable to operate normally.

sentences.english: The luxury naturist holiday spot opened its doors earlier this year.
sentences.chinese: 這家豪華的礦泉療養旅館在今年早些時候已經開業。

sentences.english: He set up shop as a retail tobacconist in the High Street.
sentences.chinese: 他在哈艾大街開業做菸草零售商。

sentences.english: The mall was opened along with the Venetian Hotel in 1999.
sentences.chinese: 購物中心於1999年與威尼斯人酒店一同開業。

sentences.english: The flagpole has been a fixture since the building was first opened a century ago.
sentences.chinese: 這個旗杆從一個世紀前飯店開業起就一直固定在那裏。

sentences.english: Face before hiking, Qin Feng says apt her ugg boots new store starts train ugg tall builds threatening force this time.
sentences.chinese: 臨走前，秦風對她說這次新店開業要造一下聲勢。

sentences.english: Recently, the cloud and county toys wisdom Park opening ceremony was held.
sentences.chinese: 日前，雲和縣玩具智慧園開業儀式被隆重舉行。

sentences.english: Finally satisifed, he authorised the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 最終的結果令他滿意，他這才許可了餐館的開業。

sentences.english: Hotel design company opened the eighth day good luck.

sentences.english: Ajisen Ramen "Kowloon City Plaza" branch launching.
sentences.chinese: 味千拉麪九龍城廣場分店現已開業。

sentences.english: Crowne Plaza Shanghai New Wing had opened.

sentences.english: The agency recently opened a Zag office in New York.
sentences.chinese: 不久之前，Zag在紐約的分公司也開業了。

sentences.english: Wal-Mart to reopen 12 quake-hit stores in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 日本地震區12家沃爾瑪重新開業。

sentences.english: She is planning to celebrate the grand opening with a huge party.
sentences.chinese: 她打算舉辦一個大型晚會來慶祝這一盛大開業典禮。
